channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Cross Initialization for Personalized Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Additionally, a fast version of our method allows for capturing an input image in roughly 26 seconds, while surpassing the baseline methods in terms of both reconstruction and editability.

item.title: BAL: Balancing Diversity and Novelty for Active Learning
item.description: Experimental results demonstrate that, when labeling 80% of the samples, the performance of the current SOTA method declines by 0. 74%, whereas our proposed BAL achieves performance comparable to the full dataset.

item.title: Optimistic and Pessimistic Actor in RL:Decoupling Exploration and Utilization
item.description: OPARL employs a unique dual-actor approach: an optimistic actor dedicated to exploration and a pessimistic actor focused on utilization, thereby effectively differentiating between exploration and utilization strategies.

item.title: Unsupervised Learning of Phylogenetic Trees via Split-Weight Embedding
item.description: The main reason for the delay in adoption of unsupervised learning in phylogenetics is the lack of a meaningful, yet simple, way of embedding phylogenetic trees into a vector space.

item.title: Social-Transmotion: Promptable Human Trajectory Prediction
item.description: Our model exhibits flexibility and adaptability by capturing spatiotemporal interactions between pedestrians based on the available visual cues, whether they are poses, bounding boxes, or a combination thereof.

item.title: Implied volatility (also) is path-dependent
item.description: Moreover, we show that up to four years of the past evolution of the underlying price should be used for the prediction and that this feedback effect gets weaker when the maturity increases.

item.title: Align on the Fly: Adapting Chatbot Behavior to Established Norms
item.description: In this paper, we aim to align large language models with the ever-changing, complex, and diverse human values (e. g., social norms) across time and locations.

item.title: Scaling Down, LiTting Up: Efficient Zero-Shot Listwise Reranking with Seq2seq Encoder-Decoder Models
item.description: We present a range of models from 220M parameters to 3B parameters, all with strong reranking results, challenging the necessity of large-scale models for effective zero-shot reranking and opening avenues for more efficient listwise reranking solutions.

item.title: Learning-To-Rank Approach for Identifying Everyday Objects Using a Physical-World Search Engine
item.description: Therefore, we focus on the task of retrieving target objects from open-vocabulary user instructions in a human-in-the-loop setting, which we define as the learning-to-rank physical objects (LTRPO) task.

item.title: A Prompt Learning Framework for Source Code Summarization
item.description: PromptCS trains a prompt agent that can generate continuous prompts to unleash the potential for LLMs in code summarization.

item.title: C2T-Net: Channel-Aware Cross-Fused Transformer-Style Networks for Pedestrian Attribute Recognition
item.description: Our performance on the PETA dataset remains competitive, standing on par with other cutting-edge models.

item.title: Robust Survival Analysis with Adversarial Regularization
item.description: Survival Analysis (SA) is about modeling the time for an event of interest to occur, which has important applications in many fields, including medicine, defense, finance, and aerospace.

item.title: Olfactory Label Prediction on aroma-chemical Pairs
item.description: The application of deep learning techniques on aroma-chemicals has resulted in models more accurate than human experts at predicting olfactory qualities.

item.title: A Comprehensive Survey of Evaluation Techniques for Recommendation Systems
item.description: Following this, we delve into predictive metrics that assess the accuracy of forecasted preferences, ranking metrics that evaluate the order in which recommendations are presented, and business metrics that align system performance with economic objectives.

item.title: EmbodiedScan: A Holistic Multi-Modal 3D Perception Suite Towards Embodied AI
item.description: In the realm of computer vision and robotics, embodied agents are expected to explore their environment and carry out human instructions.

item.title: The Clustered Orienteering Problem with Subgroups
item.description: This paper introduces an extension to the Orienteering Problem (OP), called Clustered Orienteering Problem with Subgroups (COPS).

item.title: Principled Instructions Are All You Need for Questioning LLaMA-1/2, GPT-3.5/4
item.description: This paper introduces 26 guiding principles designed to streamline the process of querying and prompting large language models.

item.title: Achieving Fairness in DareFightingICE Agents Evaluation Through a Delay Mechanism
item.description: This paper proposes a delay mechanism to mitigate the impact of latency differences in the gRPC framework--a high-performance, open-source universal remote procedure call (RPC) framework--between different programming languages on the performance of agents in DareFightingICE, a fighting game research platform.

item.title: PDiT: Interleaving Perception and Decision-making Transformers for Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Designing better deep networks and better reinforcement learning (RL) algorithms are both important for deep RL.

item.title: LaneSegNet: Map Learning with Lane Segment Perception for Autonomous Driving
item.description: A map, as crucial information for downstream applications of an autonomous driving system, is usually represented in lanelines or centerlines.

item.title: Black-Box Tuning of Vision-Language Models with Effective Gradient Approximation
item.description: Parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) methods have provided an effective way for adapting large vision-language models to specific tasks or scenarios.

item.title: The Media Bias Taxonomy: A Systematic Literature Review on the Forms and Automated Detection of Media Bias
item.description: However, we have identified a lack of interdisciplinarity in existing projects, and a need for more awareness of the various types of media bias to support methodologically thorough performance evaluations of media bias detection systems.

item.title: Learning Deformable Hypothesis Sampling for Accurate PatchMatch Multi-View Stereo
item.description: This paper introduces a learnable Deformable Hypothesis Sampler (DeformSampler) to address the challenging issue of noisy depth estimation for accurate PatchMatch Multi-View Stereo (MVS).

item.title: Improving Transferability for Cross-domain Trajectory Prediction via Neural Stochastic Differential Equation
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose a method based on continuous and stochastic representations of Neural Stochastic Differential Equations (NSDE) for alleviating discrepancies due to data acquisition strategy.

item.title: Algebraic Positional Encodings
item.description: We introduce a novel positional encoding strategy for Transformer-style models, addressing the shortcomings of existing, often ad hoc, approaches.

item.title: Large Language Models as Traffic Signal Control Agents: Capacity and Opportunity
item.description: By leveraging LLMs' impressive generalization and zero-shot reasoning capabilities, LLMLight executes a human-like decision-making process for efficient traffic management.

item.title: Monocular 3D Hand Mesh Recovery via Dual Noise Estimation
item.description: However, due to the fixed hand topology and complex hand poses, current models are hard to generate meshes that are aligned with the image well.

item.title: Generalizable Task Representation Learning for Offline Meta-Reinforcement Learning with Data Limitations
item.description: GENTLE employs Task Auto-Encoder~(TAE), which is an encoder-decoder architecture to extract the characteristics of the tasks.

item.title: MoTCoder: Elevating Large Language Models with Modular of Thought for Challenging Programming Tasks
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have showcased impressive capabilities in handling straightforward programming tasks.

item.title: Revealing the Proximate Long-Tail Distribution in Compositional Zero-Shot Learning
item.description: Building upon this insight, we incorporate visual bias caused by compositions into the classifier's training and inference by estimating it as a proximate class prior.

item.title: Three Heads Are Better Than One: Complementary Experts for Long-Tailed Semi-supervised Learning
item.description: For instance, on CIFAR-10-LT, CPE improves test accuracy by over >2. 22% compared to baselines.

item.title: Robust Stochastically-Descending Unrolled Networks
item.description: To tackle these problems, we provide deep unrolled architectures with a stochastic descent nature by imposing descending constraints during training.

item.title: Contrastive Learning-Based Framework for Sim-to-Real Mapping of Lidar Point Clouds in Autonomous Driving Systems
item.description: Motivated by this potential, this paper focuses on sim-to-real mapping of Lidar point clouds, a widely used perception sensor in automated driving systems.

item.title: RDF-star2Vec: RDF-star Graph Embeddings for Data Mining
item.description: Knowledge Graphs (KGs) such as Resource Description Framework (RDF) data represent relationships between various entities through the structure of triples (<subject, predicate, object>).

item.title: What Makes Good Data for Alignment? A Comprehensive Study of Automatic Data Selection in Instruction Tuning
item.description: We present deita (short for Data-Efficient Instruction Tuning for Alignment), a series of models fine-tuned from LLaMA and Mistral models using data samples automatically selected with our proposed approach.

item.title: A Multi-Modal Contrastive Diffusion Model for Therapeutic Peptide Generation
item.description: Therapeutic peptides represent a unique class of pharmaceutical agents crucial for the treatment of human diseases.

item.title: A Comprehensive Evaluation of Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning on Software Engineering Tasks
item.description: We hope that our findings can provide a deeper understanding of PEFT methods on various PTMs and SE downstream tasks.

item.title: UniRef++: Segment Every Reference Object in Spatial and Temporal Spaces
item.description: We evaluate our unified models on various benchmarks.

item.title: TAPE: Leveraging Agent Topology for Cooperative Multi-Agent Policy Gradient
item.description: We propose Topology-based multi-Agent Policy gradiEnt (TAPE) for both stochastic and deterministic MAPG methods.

item.title: PULASki: Learning inter-rater variability using statistical distances to improve probabilistic segmentation
item.description: In the domain of medical imaging, many supervised learning based methods for segmentation face several challenges such as high variability in annotations from multiple experts, paucity of labelled data and class imbalanced datasets.

item.title: Rotation Equivariant Proximal Operator for Deep Unfolding Methods in Image Restoration
item.description: In current deep unfolding methods, such a proximal network is generally designed as a CNN architecture, whose necessity has been proven by a recent theory.

item.title: Towards Real-World Blind Face Restoration with Generative Diffusion Prior
item.description: Blind face restoration is an important task in computer vision and has gained significant attention due to its wide-range applications.

item.title: BDIS-SLAM: A lightweight CPU-based dense stereo SLAM for surgery
item.description: Conclusion: The proposed BDIS-SLAM is a lightweight stereo dense SLAM system for MIS.

item.title: Open-Vocabulary Video Relation Extraction
item.description: A comprehensive understanding of videos is inseparable from describing the action with its contextual action-object interactions.

item.title: Deep Structure and Attention Aware Subspace Clustering
item.description: However, previous deep clustering methods, especially image clustering, focus on the features of the data itself and ignore the relationship between the data, which is crucial for clustering.

item.title: Negative Controls for Instrumental Variable Designs
item.description: Studies using instrumental variables (IV) often assess the validity of their identification assumptions using falsification tests.

item.title: Alleviating Hallucinations of Large Language Models through Induced Hallucinations
item.description: Experimental results on both discrimination-based and generation-based hallucination evaluation benchmarks, such as TruthfulQA and \textsc{FActScore}, demonstrate that our proposed ICD methods can effectively enhance the factuality of LLMs across various model sizes and families.

item.title: Solving Label Variation in Scientific Information Extraction via Multi-Task Learning
item.description: The complexity of this task is compounded by the necessity for domain-specific knowledge and the limited availability of annotated data.

item.title: Adaptive FSS: A Novel Few-Shot Segmentation Framework via Prototype Enhancement
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel framework based on the adapter mechanism, namely Adaptive FSS, which can efficiently adapt the existing FSS model to the novel classes.

item.title: Making Large Language Models A Better Foundation For Dense Retrieval
item.description: LLaRA consists of two pretext tasks: EBAE (Embedding-Based Auto-Encoding) and EBAR (Embedding-Based Auto-Regression), where the text embeddings from LLM are used to reconstruct the tokens for the input sentence and predict the tokens for the next sentence, respectively.
